content: Savings Investments CPF General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 May 2019How many of you include CPF in your networth? Our money or not our money?3 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 16 May 2019Yes, you should include CPF monies in your networth. It’s ultimately your money 37% of your income (capped at 2220) goes into it every month! It’s an asset that many Singaporeans have not fully utilised!0 comments4
Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 15 May 2019Of course....you can use it to buy a HDB. So yes, it is our money.0 comments0

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 15 May 2019Absolutely. Same way a WL death benefit is also part of your networth as it's an asset. Just unrealised gain. It's part of your networth that you may not see in total unless you outlive the national life expectancy age but it's your money and also your dependents money in the future.0 comments0
